Reason: The configuration option _journalAgeThreshold is considered performance-sensitive. This is because the _journalAgeThreshold parameter is passed to the PersistentJournal constructor, which is a critical component in managing journal entries. The age threshold determines when journal entries are considered for removal, impacting the system's memory consumption and potentially triggering frequent journal cleanups. Setting a lower age threshold can lead to more frequent operations that are time-expensive and memory-expensive, resulting in notable performance variations at the system level.
